definition[0]: to wave your arms or legs in an uncontrolled way
example[0]: He flailed wildly as she tried to hold him down.
example[1]: James flailed about in the shallow water.
definition[1]: to beat someone or something violently, usually with a stick
definition[2]: to beat grain with a flail
definition[3]: a tool consisting of a stick that swings from a long handle, used in the past to separate grain from wheat by beating it
